title: How many plates are there in one cell of lead acid batteries? - Quora

response.answer_text: It varies usually an odd number 7, 9 and 11 are common in car batterys depending on the size and shape of the battery more plates is a way of getting more surface area and more capacity making the battery longer without making it taller or wider. This is an 11 plate battery if you have more plates or larger plates the effect is the same more plate area more capacity.
